entries.definition: A group of diseases characterized by abnormal cell growth and division.
Abnormal masses of tissue that can be benign or malignant (cancerous).
The process of managing a disease, including surgery, chemotherapy, radiation therapy, and other interventions.
A type of cancer treatment that uses chemicals to kill cancer cells.
A cancer treatment that uses high-energy rays to destroy cancer cells.
The scientific investigation into the causes, diagnosis, treatment, and prevention of diseases, including cancer.
The study of heredity and variation in organisms, which can influence an individual's risk of developing certain cancers.
The care and support provided to individuals with cancer, including emotional, physical, and psychological support.
